data.title: Prince Tomohito of Mikasa
data.meta_description: Prince Tomohito of Mikasa was a first cousin of the reigning Heisei Emperor of Japan (generally known in the West by his personal name of Akihito), and, at the time of his death, was sixth in line to
data.text:
Prince Tomohito of Mikasa was a first cousin of the reigning Heisei Emperor of Japan (generally known in the West by his personal name of Akihito), and, at the time of his death, was sixth in line to the Chrysanthemum Throne. He was respected for his philanthropic work, but also at times caused controversy through his expression of opinions that were unusually forthright for a member of a generally reticent and largely ceremonial institution.

He was born in Tokyo, the second of five children and first of three sons of Prince Mikasa, the youngest brother of the then reigning Showa Emperor (personal name Hirohito). He attended the Gakushuin, or Peersâ€™ School, the traditional educational institution for members of the Imperial Family, and continued his education
